    Writing Policy Files

Reshape policy file from nested to flat

Source: R/validate-policy.R
flatten_policy.Rd

First propagates lateness to all child categories then cycles through the top-level categories of a policy file and unnests all subcategories to create a single level list of all categories and subcategories.

Usage

flatten_policy(policy)

Arguments

policy

A valid policy file stored as a list.

Value

A single level list of all categories and subcategories ordered where all leaves will precede the parent category in the list order.

Examples

# Example
flatten_policy(simple_policy)
#> $coursewide
#> $coursewide$course
#> [1] "Stat 101"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories
#> $categories[[1]]
#> $categories[[1]]$category
#> [1] "Labs"
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$aggregation
#> [1] "weighted_by_points"
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$assignments
#> [1] "Lab 1" "Lab 2" "Lab 3" "Lab 4" "Lab 5" "Lab 6"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]
#> $categories[[2]]$category
#> [1] "Discussion"
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$aggregation
#> [1] "equally_weighted"
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$weight
#> [1] 0.1
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$assignments
#> [1] "Discussion 1" "Discussion 2"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]
#> $categories[[3]]$category
#> [1] "Midterm"
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$aggregation
#> [1] "none"
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$assignments
#> [1] "Midterm"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]
#> $categories[[4]]$category
#> [1] "Final"
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$aggregation
#> [1] "none"
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$assignments
#> [1] "Final"
#> 
#> 
#>
